attributes.action: Parliament to discuss a motion of no-confidence in the coalition government.
attributes.additional_details:
It has become abundantly clear that the government is working against the best interests of the majority of the population of this country.

The Governments Equality Office should aim to improve equality and reduce discrimination and disadvantage for all, in public and political life, and in people’s life chances.  We believe that this government is working against these interests and has increased the gap between rich and poor and has subsequently increased the number of people who are disadvantaged in this country by reducing job opportunities, reducing the level of security and by reducing health and social care for all.

We want Parliament to deliver a motion of no-confidence in the coalition government and believe that this should be discussed at the earliest opportunity.

rejection.details: Votes of no confidence are a matter for Parliament and not the Government.
